# Oregon Medical Laser Center   # http://omlc.org
# by Scott Prahl                # scott.prahl@oit.edu

# radius     	  0.05000	 [microns]     (sphere radius)
# n_medium   	  1.00000	 [---]         (refractive index of medium)
# n_real     	  1.92100	 [---]         (refractive index of sphere)
# n_imag     	 -0.34800	 [---]         (absorption of sphere)
# lambda_vac 	  2.06000	 [microns]     (wavelength in vacuum)
# density    	  0.10000	 [#/micron^3]  (spheres per cubic micron)
#
# lambda     	  2.06000	 [microns]     (wavelength in medium)
# X          	  0.15250	 [---]         (size parameter)
# g          	0.0055733	 [---]         (average cosine of phase function)
# Qsca       	0.00037193	 [---]         (scattering efficiency)
# Qext       	 0.076717	 [---]         (extinction efficiency)
# Qback      	0.00055075	 [---]         (backscattering efficiency)
# Csca       	2.9211e-06	 [micron^2]    (scattering cross section)
# Cext       	0.00060254	 [micron^2]    (extinction cross section)
# Cback      	4.3256e-06	 [micron^2]    (backscattering cross section)
# mu_s       	0.00029211	 [1/mm]        (scattering coefficient)
# mu_s'      	0.00029048	 [1/mm]        (reduced scattering coefficient)
# mu_t       	 0.060254	 [1/mm]        (total attenuation coefficient)
#
#   The second column is normalized so that the integral of it over 
#   4*pi steradians will be unity.  The average of the 3rd & 4th
#   columns is the second.  The next three columns are normalized
#   to the value at 0 degrees. 
#
#       natural      = (|S1|^2+|S2|^2)/(pi X^2 Qsca)
#       perpen       = |S1|^2/(pi X^2 Qsca)
#       parallel     = |S2|^2/(pi X^2 Qsca)
#       polarization = (|S1|^2-|S2|^2)/(|S1|^2+|S2|^2)
#       S33          =  Real(S2 * S1^*)
#       S34          = -Imag(S2 * S1^*)
#
##theta	 natural 	 perpen 	 parallel	 natural 	 perpen 	 parallel	 polarization 	   S33   	   S34
